summary.para: Blocks the protected media path (PMP) process from ending.

returns.para: The method returns an HRESULT. Possible values include, but are not limited to, those in the following table.

remarks.para: When this method is called, it increments the lock count on the PMP process. For every call to this method, the application should make a corresponding call to , which decrements the lock count. When the PMP process is ready to exit, it waits for about 3 seconds, or until the lock count reaches zero, before exiting.

summary.para: Enables two instances of the Media Session to share the same protected media path (PMP) process.

remarks.para: If your application creates more than one instance of the Media Session, you can use this interface to share the same PMP process among several instances. This can be more efficient than re-creating the PMP process each time.
